properties.name: Firing Patterns
properties.description: Show how to fire bullets with different patterns.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A button that can be customized.
description: A button that can be used for menus and most labelled buttons of a game. The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

changelog.breaking: - Buttons now use "variants", allowing easy swapping of their visual aspect. You will have to make some adjustments to existing buttons in your project. Follow this [migration documentation](https://wiki.gdevelop.io/gdevelop5/objects/custom-objects-prefab-template/migrate-to-variants/) to do these changes.

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: FireBullet
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Fire bullets, manage ammo, reloading and overheating.
description: This extension allows objects to fire bullets. To use it, add the behavior to the object that will shoot, then use the provided action to launch another object as the bullet.
The properties of the behavior can be used to customize:
- Firing multiple bullets at a time ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://fire-bullet))
The speed can be specified when using the actions to fire the bullets.
The bullets are automatically given a permanent force to make them move in the 2D plane (no need to use a linear movement or move them with another behavior).
A simple example shows how to make firing patterns ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://firing-patterns)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Fire bullets with built-in cooldown, ammo, reloading, and overheating. Once added to your object that must shoot, use the behavior actions to fire another object as a bullet. These actions check all constraints internally (can be called without conditions, they will only fire when ready) and will make the bullet move (using a permanent force).
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: FireBullet

events.comment: Creators can use the "FireBullet" action multiple times in a frame and it will be counted as a single "shot".
Only reload the amount of ammo available

eventsFunctions.description: Fire bullets toward an object at a specified speed. Call this continuously, the action checks readiness internally â€” no extra timer or check needed.
eventsFunctions.name: FireTowardObject
eventsFunctions.sentence: Fire _PARAM4_ from _PARAM0_ (if ready), at position _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_, toward _PARAM5_ with speed _PARAM6_ px/s

parameters.description: X position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: XPosition

parameters.description: Y position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: YPosition

parameters.description: Speed of the bullet, in pixels per second
parameters.name: Speed

eventsFunctions.description: Fire bullets toward a position at a specified speed. Call this continuously, the action checks readiness internally â€” no extra timer or check needed.
eventsFunctions.name: FireTowardPosition

parameters.name: XPosition

parameters.description: Y position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: YPosition

parameters.description: Speed of the bullet, in pixels per second
parameters.name: Speed

eventsFunctions.description: Fire bullets in the direction of a given angle at a specified speed. Call this continuously, the action checks readiness internally â€” no extra timer or check needed.
eventsFunctions.name: Fire
eventsFunctions.sentence: Fire _PARAM4_ from _PARAM0_ (if ready), at position _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_, toward angle _PARAM5_ and speed _PARAM6_ px/s

events.comment: When firing in a full circle, prevent first and last bullet from using the same angle

parameters.description: Angle of the bullet, in degrees

parameters.description: Speed of the bullet, in pixels per second
parameters.name: Speed

eventsFunctions.sentence: Fire a single bullet _PARAM4_ from _PARAM0_, at position _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_, with angle _PARAM5_ and speed _PARAM6_ px/s

Rotate newly created bullet, if needed
